page.title: 02PRE-NORMAN
page.content: Ever since Pre-Historic times people have left some signs of their being here.The Romans built no towns in the Peterlee area although we have some evidence of them passing through for in the grounds of Shotton Hall a gold bracelet weighing about two ounces was found.The Anglo Saxons built small villages such as Old Shotton which was called Sceotton,the Scott Village,Castle Eden called Geodene or Yew Valley,Hesleden or Hesildene was the Hazel Valley and Wingate once called Windegat the Windy Road.The old Hesleden site is not in our area.When the Saxons became Christians,the land became Church property.In the 9th century the Castle Eden area was ruled by the Danes,then the Vikings raided our shores and started to settle here.They left us parts of our local dialects.
